qas.question: What is the first purpose of air defence?
What is the second purpose of air defence?
What is the critical issue in air defence?

answers.text: to hit a target moving in three-dimensional space

qas.question: Projectiles must either be guided to the target or aimed where?

answers.text: at the predicted position of the target at the time the projectile reaches it

qas.question: What two things must be considered in regards to the projectile and target?

context: The essence of air defence is to <a0_0>detect hostile aircraft<a0_0/> and <a1_0>destroy them<a1_0/>. The critical issue is <a2_0>to hit a target moving in three-dimensional space<a2_0/>; an attack must not only match these three coordinates, but must do so at the time the target is at that position. This means that projectiles either have to be guided to hit the target, or aimed <a3_0>at the predicted position of the target at the time the projectile reaches it<a3_0/>, taking into account <a4_0>speed and direction<a4_0/> of both the target and the projectile.
